page.title: 16POPULATION OF CHAGFORD
page.content: The latest figures available for the above are those of the{1981 Census, carried out by the{Parish Council.}It showed that the figure was{1304,}com_ pared to{1250}in{1971. }An interesting fact shown up was the balance of ages, as the{% of people over 60 was above {both the county and national averages. Of the total residents in the area served by the Chagford Health Centre, {nearly 100 were over the age of 80. At the other end of the spectrum the number of school_age children has de_ clined steadily. At the same time, there has been a greater increase in the number of dwellings, resulting in fewer people per household as living standards have risen. The majority view seems to be that the present pop_ ulation should remain constant, with any increase carried out 'slowly' and under proper control.
